Items.Name: Sterling Retractible Cocktail Stirrer Pendant
Items.Description: Presented by Rebecca Gelber, one of eBay's best-loved sellers with over 40000 positive feedbacks - bringing you fabulous treasures at wholesale prices! I just love this hat! It's just too cute! Made of an extremely soft, velvety black wool velour with a black satin hatband. Tiny little brim to sit cocked at an angle on the head. But the crowning glory has got to be that FEATHER! I'm not sure what type of feather is is (curly ostrich?), but it's really something: very full, curly and lush, designed to curl at an angle away from the hat. Feather tips/quills are covered with a rhinestone mesh cylinder, with the stones all prong set (and all there!) Has two small flaps to grip onto the head; they're double layered and have begun to separate, but just need a dot of glue. From The Halle Bros. Co., a now defunct high-end department store here in Cleveland. In excellent condition, no stains or damage (except for head flaps mentioned before). Size 22. Please check out my other auctions for more GREAT vintage hats, clothing and accessories! Items.Name: 1924 MARSHALL FIELD CHRISTMAS CAT.- DECO
Items.Description: This is a very neat catalog from 1924- a Marshall Field catalog that is really different. This catalog is not just pages and pages of retail items. It has a page called "fashions of the hour" that has all the social items that have happened recently at Marshall Field such as an exhibit of rare Dicken's works, the organization of a Billboard Ball, a reminder to send your gifts to Europe right now. Then there is an article on the "Hounds of Rambouillet",followed by pictures of prominent women of Chicago in Marshall Field dresses and where to find them, Jean Patou visits Marshall Field article, deco headdresses, perfumes, "gifts that make the home more charming", "dearest friends are sometimes hardest", The book section,"frilly and frivolous gifts"- accessories-gifts for childrens, undergarments, coats, dresses,sleepwear, furniture. all of these items are arranged more like a picture book than a catalog. It is a special catalog and in wonderful condition- looks like it was produced yesterday. Shipping for USA bidders is $3.50. International shipping maybe more and will be negotiated. Items.Description: Radko Big Apple New York Tour Ornament MIB _ _ __ ___ ____ _____ ______ ______ Click To Enlarge Click To Enlarge Click To Enlarge Click To Enlarge Click To Enlarge ______ ______ _____ _____ ______ ______ _______ ________ _________ _________ __________ ___________ ___________ ____________ Description ___________ __________ __________ ___________ ____________ ____________ _____________ _______________ This is one of the brand new, already out of stock everywhere, Christopher Radko Petite Big Apple Tour ornaments. Desgined prior to September 11th, it features famous New York City Landmarks - The Empire State Building, Statue of Liberty, Chrysler Building, Guggenheim Museum, New York Public Library, World Trade Center, Brooklyn Bridge, Pan Am Building, Lincoln Center, and others, all surrounding the shiny red Big Apple. The colors are vibrant (please excuse the poor photo from my flash camera), and the apple's leaf and all the buildings are dusted with glitter. A sparkiling gem! It measures about 3" tall X 3" wide X 2" deep. "Mouth-blown in tempered glass, lined with sterling silver, and hand painted with loving care", these ornaments are manufactured in Poland and are renowned for their quality and collectibility. Each ornament takes one full week to produce. The original tag is attached, as is the gold Christopher Radko charm. The ornament you will receive has never been out of the box (this one is mine!). Items.Name: ENCYCLOPEDIA of CARD SLEIGHT by Daryl Video
Items.Description: ENCYCLOPEDIA of CARD SLEIGHT by Daryl Video Volume 1 (I do have the other 7 volumes and other titles by Daryl listed in my ebay store) L & L Publishing is proud to bring you the most comprehensive video project to date. This 8-volume video series is a true encyclopedia that will provide card workers, regardless of their experience level, with all they need to improve their skills and broaden their knowledge base. L & L Publishing continually hears from satisfied customers who say they picked up one of more volumes of this project and after viewing them have gone out to purchase the entire series. This is an incredible opportunity to learn about card magic. Rather than how to apply a few moves to a card trick, this series focuses on the technical aspects of card magic and prepares viewers to handles any situation by knowing what secret weapons are available to them. Daryl goes well beyond the mechanical process and you receive the benefits of Daryl's years of experience as one of the best magicians in the world. Introduction; Playing Card Terms; Trick Break; Think Stop; One Way Backs; One Way Faces; Special Cards (Gimmicked); Special Cards (Ungimmicked); Gimmicked Card Stickers; Jumbo Gimmicked Cards Technical Terms; A Block; Cutting the Deck; Center Cut; Scarne Cut; Multiple Cuts; Pivot Cut; Swivel Cut; Shuffling the Deck; Overhand Shuffle; Hindu Shuffle; Asian Shuffle; Strip Shuffle; Rifle Shuffle; In the Hands Rifle Shuffle; Squaring the Deck; Dealing; FD Reverses the Order; FU (Stud) Maintains the Order; Group Deal; Necktie Deal; A Set Up (Stack); The Break; The Step; The Jog; Spreading the Deck; To Dribble the Cards; Palming a Card; The Control; The Crimp; The Force; The Multiple Lift; The Switch; The Change; The Color Change The Glide; The Standard Glide; As a Change; As a Control; As a Force (2 methods) The Push Up Touch; The Side Glide (2 methods); As a Glimpse; As a Multiple Force The Break; Little Finger Break; Under the Top Card (2 methods); Above the Bottom Card (2 methods) Multiple Buckle; Pull Down (or Buckle) Force; A Break from a Spread; Above Selection (to top); Below Selection (to bottom); The Riffle Touch; The Dingle Dent; The Cardini Spring; Thumb Break; Erdnase Break What To Do With A Break; Double Cut Control to the Top; Double Cut Control to the Bottom; Multiple Double Cut Control; "X" Card(s) Between Each Controlled Card; Double Cut Stacking the Deck; Triple Cut Control to the Top; Triple Cut Control to the Bottom; Control to a Sm.Number from the Top; Control to a Sm. Number from the Bottom The Step; from a Break to a Step; Put Down and Pick Up the Deck; From a Step to a Break The Jog; Out Jog; In Jog; Side Jog; Out Jog Cull; Duplex Cull (Steranko); Break Above Jog; Break Below Jog; Injog Double Cut (Steranko); Injog Double Cut Glimpse (Sternako); Injog Riffle Shuffle Control; Diagonal Push Through (Steranko); Injog Jerry Andrus Method; The Push Through (Steranko); The Thumb Jog (Steranko); The Automatic Jog #1. The name of the plate is "Joy to the World" and is the third issue in the "Heavenly Chorus Collection". The plates has a three dimensional scene of two wonderful little girl angels. One of the angels is playing a mandolin and the other little angel is holding dove in her hand. The angels are sitting on clouds. Both angels appear to be singing. The edge of the plate is trimmed with Christmas holly, red ribbons and gold bells. This is an absolutely beautiful plate. This would be a wonderful addition to Christmas decorating. The limited edition closed forever on the twenty-fifth day of April 1997. The plate is no. A399. The plate has a built in stand that allows the plate can to sit on a table or it can be hung on the wall. The music box plays Joy to the World. Items.Description: .titledata { font-family: verdana, sans-serif; font-size:17px; color:#ffffff; font-weight : bold; } .description { font-family: verdana, sans-serif; color:#ffffff; } a.textLink { color:#9197BF;} HR { color: #ffffff; } Doctor and Doll ROCKWELL Little Girl/Doll Here we have the Little Girl and Her Doll based on the Norman Rockwell Saturday Evening Post cover illustration which appeared on March 9, 1929. The Doctor and the Doll - (Doc is in the other room I guess!)... If you have any questions about the above listed item, please e-mail me and I will do my best to help you. ********************PLEASE READ******************** I do not run auctions on a casual basis just to use my spare or idle time. Auctioning to me, is a serious business that I do not take lightly and expect that the others involved (on the bidding end) feel the same way. With this in mind, if you feel there is something in my auction you do not agree with, please contact me and I will address your concerns to the best of my ability. Whenever possible, I provide my bidders with a FIXED, not actual, cost of shipping and handling. I evaluate each of my items on an individual basis for such costs and these charges reflect the USPS shipping rate for that item plus a nominal fee to cover other costs such as handling, and packing materials needed to secure the purchased item(s). As such, my shipping terms are very straight forward and are not subject to reevaluation, unless there are sever circumstances where the item is either very heavy or awkward, in which case I usually state the total cost for shipping will be determined "BY YOUR GEOGRAPHIC LOCATION". This allows me to give a fairer price for shipping and handling fees and cater to my bidders on a more personal level. In such cases, you are still subject to a FIXED cost for shipping and handling , so please do not complain after you are committed to the purchase. Since it is difficult for me to determine where a bidder lives, I ask my bidders to find out about shipping costs before placing their bids on my items, so as to eliminate any problems about shipping costs. One last note: I state that payment is due within 10 days of the end of the auction. This means that the total payment for the item (winning bid) plus the cost of shipping, handling and insurance charges are due!! If partial payments are made in error, I will contact you about the problem and expect an expeditious reply and payment. Please contact me with any further questions. Thank You for looking and good luck bidding!

Items.Name: WONDER WOMAN 10 VG;GUIDE 252.00
Items.Description: Early Wonder Womans are always hard to find,and sometimes appear very undervalued compared to similar period golden age.We are pleased to be able to present a nice early group in this and other auctions.All books are unrestored and original unless otherwise stated.WONDER WOMAN 10;solid and unrestored with supple pages that are mostly off white to cream.2 tiny chip outs are obvious,but the cover is NOT fragile in any way-the comic is structurally solid with an intact,solid spine. Also Note that this scan generally will overstate defects.Nevertheless bid with confidence! The grades you see are extremely accurate. (Read what the buyer of a $1000.00 AF 15 recently said about our scan-nov 28 2001 feedback, or just to confirm read the Dec 3 2001 feedback of a VF Green Lantern purchase OR read what a buyer of a nm Thor said"Pinpoint grading (an ebay rarity!) Recommend this seller.Dec 3 2001)).All grades are guarenteed within 0.5 of any grading service. The grade quoted above is an accurate grade reflecting the true condition of the book.(Any defect not revealed by the large scan will be discussed apart).The price is set so that you will be hard pressed to find as good a deal anywhere else.(This 33% bigger scan( than the books' actual size) magnifies and enlarges defects-it is like looking at the book through a magnification factor). Generally speaking the book possess's a solid intact spine with no splits;staples solidly in place;gloss and color deapth vivid,deep and close to new in appearance;only minor spine stress marks exist;overall a glossy off white to WHITE paged copy offered at an unbeatable initial bid ,with a LOW RESERVE(This low reserve allows our customers to use the buy it now feature.Many have missed out on previous books,and this feature usually prolongs the auction a bit longer to give everyone a chance to bid).As we have a large multiple grade inventory of Silver and Golden age books,many will be offered for sale in coming ads.There are many comics being auctioned off on Ebay this week.Combine auctions to save postage.THOUSANDS of other books are still to come including most Marvel and DC titles from 1960 -1972.Use the BUY IT NOW feature to end the auction and lock out the competition. We are multiple CBG award winners;EBAY Power sellers;and have 1000 total positive feedbacks(many multiple) since we began here about 2 years ago.Some may remember us for our full page Marvel adds starting in the 1980's.Our Marvel inventory is extensive and stocked in multiple conditions..Note.All our scans are "High resolution".That means a magnified, extremley detailed scan which is about 33% LARGER than the actual size of the comic.( so, of course, defects appear about 1/3rd bigger,than if you were viewing the item right in front of you)..Why do we do this?Why do we want the comic to have all the defects OVERSTATED? Here are the reasons; 1)All defects are CLEARLY seen.(in our opinion a small scan is of no use-the grade can be anything). 2) By revealing all defects,you can grade based upon what you like or dislike about a book. 3) No two grades have the same defects,thus a large scan allows you to delineate the key aspects of the book. 4)A large scan will OVERSTATE defects.Defects appear LARGER than what you will see when you get the book.(This applies especially to creases(thicker than actual),and stress marks,and to a lesser extent to color tones,which may show gradations in color not visible with the naked eye).Most of our customers note that the book is nicer when it arrives than what this scan revealed(reasons;the scans bright flood light reveal evey single microscopic impact point,plus defects appear 33% larger.) 5)All our books are guaranteed to be in the same general grade range(within+/- 0.5) if the book is slabbed(within 14 days of purchase) 6) Full exchange privledges on any item purchased.within 7 days. 7) Shipping : Cost; 5.00 for less than 5 comics(priority mail with delivery confirmation) in North America NOTE ;Allow 2 weeks for material to reach you;we often beat that,but increased security screening by the post office can delay shipping time;we take full responsibility.... ..Questions and/or comments? Call 514 630 4518..We reserve the right to reject any bids we deem unacceptable,or not likely valid..Contact us BEFORE placing bid if you have a less than 10 rating... All winning bidders must respond and establish how they will pay within 24 hours of auction completion. Further questions? 8) Paypal and credit cards accepted from most customers.We Will be glad to offer detailed answers,at our email address; omc@cam.org Click image to view larger version Low cost image hosting and full service auction management solutions: AuctionWatch
